newsitem.title: USA: TIMES MIRROR IN TWO-PART PACT WITH CHANDLERS.
newsitem.headline: TIMES MIRROR IN TWO-PART PACT WITH CHANDLERS.

text.p: Times Mirror Co, publisher of the Los Angeles Times, said Friday it has executed agreements with its largest shareholders, the Chandler Trusts, aimed at achieving the company's target capital structure.

Under the pending two-part transaction, Times Mirror and the trusts will make equal capital contributions to form a limited liability company, or "LLC." Chandis Securities, a holding company principally owned by one of the Chandler Trusts, will then be merged into a subsidiary of Times Mirror.

Times Mirror said that the transaction will, for financial reporting purposes, reduce its outstanding series A common stock by six million shares and its outstanding 8 percent series A preferred stock by $367 million of stated value. it said.
Completion of the transaction is subject to approval by Times Mirror's board, which will meet to consider the transaction later today, it said.
"This reduction in common and preferred shares will enable us to achieve our target capital structure," said Mark Willes, Times Mirror chairman, president and chief executive officer.
At the same time, Times Mirror will continue to use active open market share repurchase program to maintain this capitalization, he said.
Shareholders will benefit from this transaction, he said, adding that it would be accretive to earnings per share in 1997 and add more than 10 cents per share in 1998.
Times Mirror said it will contribute to the limited liability company its real property, with a market value of $226 million, and $249 million in cash.
The real estate will be then be leased back to Times Mirror under long-term leases, and the cash will be invested in a portfolio of securities of unrelated issuers.
The Chandler Trusts will contribute five million shares of the series A common stock valued at $254 million, and $221 million stated value of 8 percent series A preferred stock.

For financial reporting purposes Times Mirror will be considered to have acquired 80 percent of the shares of the series A common stock contributed to the limited liability company, or about four million shares.

Times Mirror will also be considered to have acquired 80 percent of the 8 percent series A preferred stock contributed, or about $177 million of stated value. Due to the allocations, the dividends on such shares are effectively eliminated.
The merger will result in the reduction of the series A common stock by two million shares and the acquisition of $190 million stated value of 8 percent series A preferred stock.

A Times Mirror subsidiary will become the owner of all of Chandis Securities' assets, including approximately 8.6 million shares of Times Mirror's series A common stock, about 9.7 million shares of the company's series C common, about $190 million stated value of the company's 8 percent series A preferred stock, and $21 million of real estate, cash and other miscellaneous assets.

As consideration for the merger, Times Mirror will issue to the former Chandis Securities shareholders 6.6 million shares of series A common, 9.7 million of shares of series C common and a total of $313 million stated value of newly authorized participating preferred stock.

The annual dividend rate of the participating preferred stock will be 5.8 percent commencing October 1, through December 31, 2000, and is subject to possible upward adjustment, to a maximum rate of 8.4 percent.

Times Mirror, a Los Angeles-based news and information company, publishes the Los Angeles Times, Newsday, The Baltimore Sun, and other newspapers; a wide array of professional information for the legal, health sciences, aviation and training markets and consumer magazines.
